title: When you are staring at their team trying to figure out who is in which lane
body:
and then realize they have a Jungle Soraka
http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/crngwrth.gif

{{champion:14}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:53}} 
Element of surprise op
There's nothing about Sion that's surprising, really.

*{GONG!}*

***"COWAAAAAARDS!"***

*{runs away}*
_{Proving Sion right}_

The element of surprise is when he's jungling. You don't know where he's going to come from... All you know is that you heard his ult go off and you're sitting there going 'SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, SHIT'

That's more "impending doom" than it is "element of surprise," though.

Regardless, Sion is great. 11/10 champion, love 'em to death.
Sion support.
not that good even if its seems like it (AKA {{champion:27}}  support.... yes i tried once)
Fun as hell though.

tru
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

He is LEAGUES above Singed support though. He misses out of CS unfortunately, but he does provide harass and 3 forms of CC just like in his solo lane.

I won a bot lane as supp sion with a {{champion:74}} once even.
State your opinion after you facecheck the bush.
Clearly you have Sion and Yi dance in the mid-lane as a distraction because they have the best dances of the bunch. Then suddenly everything.
Needs more {{champion:107}}

WHAT THE FUCK??? WHERE ARE THEY GOING??? WHO THE FUCKING FUCK IS FUCKING WHAT???

Soraka support
Thresh ADC
Lulu mid
Bard toplane
Tahm Kench jungle
but wait, thresh has smite?
except  lulu is better top. id put bard mid that roam OP

First time I encountered a totally strange comp:
All five went top, started well, then died to our Akali while my carry and I got both bot turrets (we were pushed away by a farmed Zac and lack of mana because we pushed hard). They kept pushing top but it just didn't work out and we won. 

Second time:
Recently encountered a Leona-Kassadin bot lane. I played Jinx and had a (super crazy insane awesome) Naut support. Double-kill'd them, then got GP  who teleported down with tower and Naut CC for a triple. Found it funny they filled a Mage for an ADC in the ADC meta. Like I said, super insane Naut, I went 15/0. 

Third time:
Also recently I had a Fiora-Jax bot lane vs (me) Thresh-Graves. They were so aggressive but seemed to forget range differences, so every time Jax jumped on Graves I hooked him into tower. Weird but easy lane for us. Fiora also tower dove me, got the kill, got executed, and called worth. 
/all LOL you couldn't even get an auto off on me
Bish please I was oom and trying to back you ain't special. "Oh I'm half health,oom, and being chased, let me turn around and fight this Fiora!"

supp:{{champion:22}} {{champion:51}}
they're in every role
Wait yea but it was a typo I meant Mage for an ADC but yes ADC are all around us O.o
I recently went Azir ADC to some success. Granted, our midlane Quinn got fed out of her ass, but still, some success. xD
i tried it a few times. its tricky to master the art of using your soldiers for mobility without attacking with them in a duel

I played a game once back before the article on LCS Support {{champion:48}} was published, where I was support Trundle. Or I was going to be.

The enemy team was all supports. Their main purpose was to all go top and protect {{champion:26}} . They kept farming our {{champion:62}} for zil's gold as he got stronger and stronger. I kept telling him and my team to leave and farm/push elsewhere so that they would be forced to split up and be weaker.

They wouldn't stop letting Zil farm them.

I stayed in bot lane and farmed alone for about 12 minutes. I came back out with {{item:3065}} and {{item:3153}} . I began farming the "supports" after I shut down zilean. Eventually started on {{item:3155}} and became un-killable since they were all AP.

That day I learned Trundle "support" was clearly the best support as I took down a whole team of fed "supports".

Soraka jungle could be viable this season. I didn't tried yet, but the wave clear is much more fast then people tend to believe and the ganks never fail, you don't even need an opponent to gank as raka...
Dam that's some pretty good acting
okay?
